intro: Hieracium incisum subsp. golesnicae, commonly known as the Golešnica hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, serrated leaves and yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has a compact growth habit with a basal rosette of leaves and can reach a height of up to 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
